name: tuna, capture by purse seiner and landing whole, frozen | small pelagic fish, fresh | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19139/documentation

This activity represents capture and landing of Pacific tunas by purse seining. The life cycle inventories were produced for one of the largest Ecuadorean tuna fishing and processing companies, featuring a vertically-integrated tuna fleet. Data from a 13-vessel fleet owned and operated by the company were extrapolated to characterise the whole Ecuadorian tuna fleet of 107 purse seiners. The Ecuadorian tuna fleet operates in the EPO, roughly corresponding to the FAO catch zone 87. This fleet represented in 2008 roughly 44 % of the Eastern Pacific Ocean (EPO) purse seiner fleet and 17 % of the global tuna purse seiner fleet. In 2013, the Ecuadorian fleet represented 38 % of the EPO tuna fleet and landed 42 % of that year’s 554,000-t captures in the EPO. It targets three main tuna species: yellowfin (Thunnus albacares), skipjack (Katsuwonus pelamis) and bigeye (Thunnus obesus). The resulting inventory is representative of the Ecuadorian tuna fishery, and of global tuna fisheries using purse seining. ;System boundaries and relation between activities

From vessel use and maintenance phases, including all upstream activities
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data corresponds to the landings-weighted average of annual opperation for 2012 and 2013.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Tuna is captured in Eastern Pacific Ocean waters.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology deployed in the EPO includes helicopter spotters used by some of the largest vessels, purse seining based on three types of sets: non-associated with other species (35 %), using fish aggregation devices (FADs, 60 %) and associated with dolphins (5 %); and freezing on-board. Fuel used by spotters is included in the inventory.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: 13 vessels out of 107, over two years of operations. Sample belongs to a single company, representative of national operations.

exchanges.description: Construction of a purse seiner, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW). Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication. Lifespan: 35 years; uncertainty data for annual landings per vessel described in the parameter definition
